page.title: 02Nempnett Thrubwell - Origins
page.content: Population 163 - 1981 census. The village consists of a few cottages clustered round the Church, 4 council houses, a few of houses below Breach Hill, and some larger properties and 8 farms scattered among the hills. The twisty lanes fall eventually down to Blagdon Lake (Yeo Reservoir) to the S.W. The curious name of the village is derived from Emnett (Old English) meaning "plain" and Throb-well, a "gushing stream". It does not conform to the modern idea of a "plain", being hilly, but gushing streams certainly, especially in wet weather. The name possibly refers to{Pixie Hole,}once a narrow gully of rushing water, now a steep lane running from Dew Down to Ubley. The area must once have been an ancient settlement. To the west there is a{Neolithic Longbarrow,}known for some curious reson as{"Fairy Tootes".}
